it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.server

Class AbstractCoapServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.server.AbstractCoapServer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoapServer

    public abstract class AbstractCoapServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract stateful CoAP server. It handles CoAP GET, PUT, and DELETE requests statefully, automatically handling request/response retransmissions.

    It supports resource observation (RFC 7641) and blockwise transfer (RFC 7959).

    An actual CoAP server must implement one (or more) of the following methods:

    • handleGetRequest(CoapRequest) - processes a new incoming GET request,
    • handlePostRequest(CoapRequest) - processes a new incoming POST request,
    • handlePutRequest(CoapRequest) - processes a new incoming PUT request,
    • handleDeleteRequest(CoapRequest) - processes a new incoming DELTE request,
    • handleObserveRequest(CoapRequest) - processes a new incoming observe request,
    • handleObserveTerminated(CoapRequest) - processes an observe termination.

    Please see the source code of CoapServer as example of use.
